H0.text: Growth is defined as the passage of genetic instructions from one generation to the next.

H1.text: Heredity is the passage of genetic instructions from one generation to the next.

H2.text: Development is defined as the passage of genetic instructions from one generation to the next.

H3.text: Reproduction is defined as the passage of genetic instructions from one generation to the next.

A4.text: Heredity, also called inheritance or biological inheritance, is the passing on of traits from parents to their offspring; either through asexual reproduction or sexual reproduction, the offspring cells or organisms acquire the genetic information of their parents.

A5.text: Before a cell divides through mitosis, the DNA is copied, so that each of the resulting two cells will inherit the DNA sequence.
